title: Dropout as a Bayesian Approximation: Representing Model Uncertainty in Deep Learning
abstract: Deep learning tools have recently gained much attention in applied machine learning. However such tools for regression and classification do not allow us to capture model uncertainty. Bayesian models offer us the ability to reason about model uncertainty, but usually come with a prohibitive computational cost.
histories: 11 pages, 6 figures; Minor corrections in experiments section
12 pages, 6 figures; fixed a mistake with standard error and added a new table with updated results (marked "Update [October 2016]"); Published in ICML 2016
